intro: Galium decaisnei, commonly known as the mountain bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers during the spring and early summer. Galium decaisnei thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky slopes. Its botanical features make it an important species in the study of alpine flora and ecological succession.
